CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 29, 1945, pg. 12, reads: "Annual Christmas Treat - George Gaines, prominent Pittsburgh business and civic leader, did not disappoint the kiddies who look forward to the annual Yule treat that the philanthropist provides each Christmas for the children of his neighborhood. 'Almost as much fun as Santa Claus' is what the children have to say about the party.  They know that Mr. Gaines always has the best of candy and other holiday goodies to give them as an expression of his affection for them. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of George W. Gaines in center giving boxes of candy to children, with pile of boxes in background, for annual Christmas celebration in Gaines Funeral Home, another version
